channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: The Perl and Raku Conference 2025
item.description: Greenville, South Carolina, USA

item.title: German Perl/Raku Workshop Conference 2025
item.description: Munich, Germany

item.title: Boston.pm monthly meeting
item.description: Virtual event

item.description: Virtual Event

item.title: Paris.pm monthly meeting
item.description: Paris, France

item.title: Boston.pm monthly meeting
item.description: Virtual event

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Great CPAN modules released last week.

item.title: Odd Arrays
item.description: Nice demo of Scalar solution. You get to learn something new every week by just reading the post. Highly recommended.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #310
item.description: Smart use of 'mesh' from CPAN module List::SomeUtils. Clever move, well done.

item.title: Arrays and arrays
item.description: As the title suggests, plenty of loops. Why not? Go for it and don't forget to use DIY tool.

item.title: Make it even
item.description: Love the story around the solution. It makes it fun reading, well done and keep it up.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 310
item.description: Here you have another fan of CPAN modules. Checkout the use of CPAN in one-liner. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Odd Sets
item.description: I am a big fan of PDL. I just love the final product. Keep sharing the magic.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 310
item.description: Perl and Raku side by side as always. You will clearly see the similarities. Great work.

item.title: Intersection Sort
item.description: Raku one-liner by the master himself. Good to see Raku flexing muscles.

item.title: TWC310
item.description: Good use of CPAN modules. As always we have a compact and cute solutions. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Arrays Intersect in Odd Ways
item.description: Love the use of v5.38 but surprised not to see method signature in action. Thanks for sharing knowledge.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 310
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Arrays Intersection" and "Sort Odd Even" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 311
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Upper Lower" and "Group Digit Sum". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Mid-life upgrade for the MailBox suite
item.description: Are you a user of MailBox? If yes then please hekp Mark during the test phase of the rework.

item.title: 3D Object Scripting using OpenSCAD and Perl
item.description: Fun story telling skill with plenty of tech talk in between. I also liked the use of Object::Pad.

item.title: MCE - How to?
item.description: A gentle introduction to MCE (Many-Core Engine) about parallel processing.

item.title: Slurp in Perl
item.description: Refresh the newly added command line flag '-g' in Perl v5.36.

item.title: Hosting a Secure Static Website with S3 and CloundFront: Part III
item.description: Time for the final word on the series. Highly recommended.

item.title: Hosting a Secure Static Website with S3 and CloudFront: Part IIb
item.description: Third installment of the series for you.

item.title: Hosting a Secure Static Website with S3 and CloudFront: Part IIa
item.description: Part II of the series carried forward.

item.title: Hosting a Secure Static Website with S3 and CloudFront: Part I
item.description: Nice blog series sharing behind the scene secrets. If you are into cloud tech then you must checkout.

item.title: Step-by-Step Guide to Learning PERL Programming: From Novice to Expert
item.description: Worth reading even if you already know the language.

item.title: Learning Perl in 2025
item.description: Nice collections, new to Perl then this is for you.

item.title: This week in PSC (179) | 2025-02-14
item.description: Looks like a busy meet, nice to see things are moving quickly.

item.title: Announce Perl.Wiki.html V 1.24
item.description: For Perl Wiki fan, this is for you.

item.title: From Code to Community: Sponsoring TPRC 2025
item.description: The North American Perl and Raku Conference will soon be upon us, and that means now is a great time to show your support for this very special event. This year there are many available sponsorship tiers and lots of opportunities for your organization to support the conference.

item.title: #710 - PPC - Perl Proposed Changes
item.description:
Hi there,

Do you remember, the weekly newsletter where I mentioned about the work carried out for PPC web portal?

Well, it is now fully functional and operative: PPC. It has everything that you need to know about the future plan of Perl. Not only that, you can also involve in the new feature request. It made the process smooth and easy to understand. You can also take part in the discussion as well. This is your opportunity to share your view on the work being carried out. Or if you have any suggestion, you can use the template to submit your ideas. Isn't it simple? The best part for me is the ability to join the discussion in the work being done before it becomes the part of future release.

In the last edition of newsletter, there was an announcement about German Perl/Raku Workshop and Perl Toolchain Summit. I encourage every community members to come forward and help the organisers to make it reach wider audiences. There is another announcement about The North American Perl and Raku Conference. Please do share the details with your colleagues and friends.

Are you new to Perl and want to learn in 2025 then checkout this post. Here is another: Step-by-Step Guide to Learning PERL Programming: From Novice to Expert.

Today is the Day 3 of Ramadan in England. May ALLAH s.w.t bless you with peace, happiness and prosperity.

Enjoy rest of the newsletter.
item.dc:subject: editorial
